Jose Mourinho has taken an incredibly obvious pop at Jurgen Klopp regarding the way they are being treated by match officials. 
The Manchester United boss was speaking after his side's goalless home draw with Hull on Wednesday night. 
Several incidents in the match occurred - including two shocking challenges by Oumar Niasse - which caused Jose Mourinho to lose his cool on the touchline. 
The Red Devils boss was told by the fourth official to sit down or risk being sent to the stands. Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp remonstrates with the fourth official after Chelsea are awarded a penalty (Photo: REUTERS) 
The incident is of stark contrast to Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp's on Tuesday night. 
The German was seen screaming in fourth official Neil Swarbrick's face during the Reds' home clash against Chelsea. 
Klopp later revealed he apologised and that Swarbrick replied, 'no problem, I like your passion'. Jose Mourinho feels he's being treated unfairly (Photo: Julian Finney) 
Speaking in his post-match press conference, Mourinho said: "You know clearly that I am different. 
"I am different, the rules for me are different. I am different in everything. I watch my team in the hotel, I was forbidden to go to the stadium. Wenger recently received a four-game ban for pushing a fourth official (Photo: Sky Sports) 
Mourinho even took a thinly veiled dig at Arsene Wenger before popping at Klopp. 
"My assistant had a six matches stadium ban, I didn't touch anyone," he said. 
"Yesterday one fourth official told to a manager, 'I very much enjoy your passion, so do what you want to do.' Today I was told sit down or I will send you to the stands." poll loading Is Jose Mourinho unfairly treated by referees? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
